pros: Interesting work working with leading surgeons, consultants and in general lovely and helpful medical staff. The communications team is small but tight-knit, everyone happily helps each other out.
cons:
Unfortunately there are some real issues with management of this division which seem to be historical. Poor retention in communications with people tending to leave in under a year. In general clinical staff at the trust seem to be engaged, valued and treated well, but there is a very different culture in communications. Poor management, lack of direction, inconsistent demands and I would say a lack of interest in staff wellbeing and flexible working arrangements are all issues here. 
Broader, I do think there is an issue with hierarchy at the trust. Leadership teams/executives are not visible and many of them do not seem to make an interest to be so. In some ways it is a very old fashioned place to work, with senior people being able to behave in ways or get away with things junior staff would not. This is not across the board and the CEO has made efforts to be more visible and accessible during covid-19, but there are a few individuals who have been at the trust for a long time who seem a bit untouchable. The trust has been through a lot being at the heart of covid-19, the medical services and teams seem second to none and very proud to be part of the trust, but different standards seem to apply in some - not all- non medical divisions.
